SEARCH
Package hms.storage

Class CSVService

java.lang.Object
hms.storage.CSVService
All Implemented Interfaces:
IReadable, IWritable
public class CSVService extends Object implements IReadable, IWritable
Provides services for handling CSV file operations. This class supports reading, writing, and modifying CSV files associated with different user roles such as doctors, patients, administrators, and pharmacists. It also manages user credentials through CSV files.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public List<List<String>> read(String filePath)
      Description copied from interface: IReadable
      Reads data from a specified file and returns it organized as a list of lists. Each inner list represents a single line or record from the file, parsed into its constituent elements.
      Specified by:
      read in interface IReadable
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file that is to be read. The file should exist and be accessible.
      Returns:
      A List of Lists of Strings, where each inner List contains the elements of a single line or record in the file. The structure and content of the returned list depend on the implementation and the nature of the file being read.

    • write

      public void write(String filePath, List<List<String>> data)
      Description copied from interface: IWritable
      Writes data to a specified file. The data is provided as a list of lists, where each inner list represents a line or record that should be written to the file.
      Specified by:
      write in interface IWritable
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the file where data is to be written. If the file does not exist, it should be created. If it does exist, this method may either overwrite it or append to it, depending on the implementation.
      data - A List of Lists of Strings, where each inner List contains the elements of a single line or record that should be written to the file. How these elements are formatted and written to the file depends on the implementation specifics.

    • modifyCsv

      public void modifyCsv(String filePath, int rowIndex, int colIndex, String newValue)
      Modifies a specific cell in a CSV file based on provided row and column indices and a new value.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the CSV file to be modified.
      rowIndex - The row index of the cell to modify.
      colIndex - The column index of the cell to modify.
      newValue - The new value to set in the specified cell.

    • replaceUser

      public static void replaceUser(User user)
      Updates the record of a user in the system by identifying their role and executing role-specific write operations to the appropriate CSV file. If the user is a doctor, pharmacist, or administrator, the method locates their existing record by hospital ID, replaces the record with updated data, and refreshes the list of all users of that type in the system. If no valid role is identified (i.e., the role does not start with 'd' for doctors, 'p' for pharmacists, or 'a' for administrators), an error message is displayed. After updating the specific user type list, the global user list cache is also refreshed to reflect these changes.
      Parameters:
      user - The user instance with updated information that needs to be written to the CSV. The method handles type casting based on the user's role to call the correct write method.

    • getSalt

      public String getSalt(String ID)
      Retrieves a cryptographic salt associated with a user ID from the credentials CSV.
      Parameters:
      ID - The hospital ID of the user whose salt is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The salt as a string, or an empty string if the user is not found.

    • writeDoctorsToCSV

      public static void writeDoctorsToCSV(List<Doctor> doctors)
      Writes a list of Doctor objects to a CSV file, overwriting any existing data. This method serializes Doctor instances into CSV format according to predefined schemas.
      Parameters:
      doctors - A list of Doctor objects to be written to the CSV file.

    • readDoctorsFromCSV

      public static List<Doctor> readDoctorsFromCSV()
      Reads a list of Doctor objects from a CSV file, deserializing each row into a Doctor instance. Assumes the first row of the CSV file is a header row.
      Returns:
      A list of Doctor objects read from the file.

    • writePatientsToCSV

      public static void writePatientsToCSV(List<Patient> patients)
      Writes a list of Patient objects to a CSV file, including a header row followed by rows for each Patient.
      Parameters:
      patients - A list of Patient objects to be serialized and written to the CSV file.

    • readPatientsFromCSV

      public static List<Patient> readPatientsFromCSV()
      Reads a list of Patient objects from a CSV file, deserializing each row into a Patient instance.
      Returns:
      A list of Patient objects read from the file.

    • writeAdminsToCSV

      public static void writeAdminsToCSV(List<Administrator> admins)
      Writes a list of Administrator objects to a CSV file specified by the ADMIN_CSV_PATH. This method starts by writing a header line followed by one line per Administrator in CSV format as returned by the Administrator's toCSV method.
      Parameters:
      admins - A list of Administrator objects to be serialized and written to the CSV file. Each Administrator is converted to a CSV string format which includes their hospital ID, name, gender, age, and role.

    • readAdminsFromCSV

      public static List<Administrator> readAdminsFromCSV()
      Reads a list of Administrator objects from a CSV file. Assumes the first line of the CSV contains headers and skips it. Each subsequent line is processed to create an Administrator object using the Administrator.fromCSV method.
      Returns:
      A list of Administrator objects populated from the CSV file.

    • writePharmacistsToCSV

      public static void writePharmacistsToCSV(List<Pharmacist> pharmacists)
      Writes a list of Pharmacist objects to a CSV file. Starts by writing a header line, followed by one line per Pharmacist in CSV format as returned by the Pharmacist's toCSV method.
      Parameters:
      pharmacists - A list of Pharmacist objects to be serialized and written to the CSV file.

    • readPharmacistsFromCSV

      public static List<Pharmacist> readPharmacistsFromCSV()
      Reads a list of Pharmacist objects from a CSV file, skipping the header line. Each line is processed to create a Pharmacist object using the Pharmacist.fromCSV method, which should parse the CSV line into appropriate fields.
      Returns:
      A list of Pharmacist objects populated from the CSV file.

    • readUsersFromCSV

      public static List<User> readUsersFromCSV()
      Compiles a list of all users in the system across various roles by reading their details from respective CSV files. It aggregates lists of patients, doctors, administrators, and pharmacists into a single list of users.
      Returns:
      A comprehensive list of all users including Patients, Doctors, Administrators, and Pharmacists.

    • replacePatient

      public static void replacePatient(Patient patient)
      Replaces a patient's information in the CSV file by first finding the patient's index using their hospital ID and then writing the updated patient data back to the CSV.
      Parameters:
      patient - The patient object containing updated data to be stored.

    • findPatient

      public static int findPatient(String patientID)
      Searches for a patient by their hospital ID in the CSV file and returns their index. This method reads the patient CSV to find a matching hospital ID and returns the index of the found patient or -1 if the patient is not found.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The hospital ID of the patient to find.
      Returns:
      The index of the patient in the list if found, otherwise -1.

    • writePatient

      public static void writePatient(Patient patient, int index)
      Writes a single patient's updated information to the CSV file at a specified index. If the index is out of range, a warning message is displayed and the operation is aborted.
      Parameters:
      patient - The patient object containing updated data.
      index - The index in the CSV file where the patient data should be updated.

    • replaceDoctor

      public static void replaceDoctor(Doctor doctor)
      Replaces a doctor's information in a CSV file. This method finds a doctor by ID, replaces the doctor's information with updated data, and writes the updated list back to the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      doctor - The Doctor object containing updated information to be written to the CSV.

    • removeDoctor

      public static void removeDoctor(Doctor doctor)
      Removes a doctor's record from the CSV file by swapping it with the last record and then deleting the last record. This method ensures that the CSV file is compacted after removal to avoid any gaps in the data.
      Parameters:
      doctor - The doctor object to be removed from the CSV file.

    • findDoctor

      public static int findDoctor(String doctorID)
      Finds the index of a doctor by their hospital ID in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - The hospital ID of the doctor to find.
      Returns:
      The index of the doctor if found, otherwise -1.

    • getLastDoctor

      public static Doctor getLastDoctor()
      Retrieves the last doctor from the CSV file.
      Returns:
      The last doctor in the list if available, null otherwise.

    • removeLastDoctor

      public static void removeLastDoctor()
      Removes the last doctor from the CSV file, effectively deleting the record.

    • writeDoctor

      public static void writeDoctor(Doctor doctor, int index)
      Writes a doctor's data at a specific index in the CSV file, used primarily to replace data at a given position.
      Parameters:
      doctor - The doctor object to write to the CSV file.
      index - The index at which to write the doctor's data.

    • replaceAdmin

      public static void replaceAdmin(Administrator admin)
      Replaces an administrator's data in the CSV file. This function finds the existing record by hospital ID, then updates it with the provided administrator data if found.
      Parameters:
      admin - The administrator object containing updated data.

    • findAdmin

      public static int findAdmin(String adminID)
      Searches for an administrator in the CSV file by their hospital ID and returns the index position in the list. Outputs a message if the administrator is not found.
      Parameters:
      adminID - The hospital ID of the administrator to find.
      Returns:
      The index of the administrator if found, otherwise -1 indicating not found.

    • writeAdmin

      public static void writeAdmin(Administrator admin, int index)
      Writes the administrator's data to a specific index in the CSV file. If the index is out of range, an error message is displayed. This method is used primarily to update existing records with new data.
      Parameters:
      admin - The administrator whose data is to be written to the CSV.
      index - The index in the list where the data should be updated.

    • removePharmacist

      public static void removePharmacist(Pharmacist pharmacist)
      Removes a pharmacist's record from the CSV file by replacing it with the last record and then deleting the last record. This method ensures that the CSV file is compacted after removal to avoid any gaps in the data.
      Parameters:
      pharmacist - The pharmacist object to be removed from the CSV file.

    • getLastPharmacist

      public static Pharmacist getLastPharmacist()
      Retrieves the last pharmacist from the CSV file.
      Returns:
      The last pharmacist in the list, or null if the list is empty.

    • removeLastPharmacist

      public static void removeLastPharmacist()
      Removes the last pharmacist from the CSV file and updates the file accordingly.

    • replacePharmacist

      public static void replacePharmacist(Pharmacist pharmacist)
      Replaces a pharmacist's information in the CSV file. Finds the pharmacist's index by hospital ID and writes the updated data to that position in the CSV.
      Parameters:
      pharmacist - The pharmacist object containing updated information.

    • findPharmacist

      public static int findPharmacist(String pharmacistID)
      Searches for a pharmacist by their hospital ID in the CSV file and returns their index.
      Parameters:
      pharmacistID - The hospital ID of the pharmacist to find.
      Returns:
      The index of the pharmacist if found, otherwise -1.

    • writePharmacist

      public static void writePharmacist(Pharmacist pharmacist, int index)
      Writes a pharmacist's updated information to a specific index in the CSV file. If the index is out of range, an error message is displayed and the operation is aborted.
      Parameters:
      pharmacist - The pharmacist whose information is to be updated.
      index - The index at which to update the information.

    • changePassword

      public void changePassword(String hospitalID, int newHash)
      Changes the password hash for a specific user identified by their hospital ID in the credentials CSV file. If the hospital ID is found, it updates the hash value and writes the changes back to the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - The hospital ID of the user whose password needs to be changed.
      newHash - The new hash value for the user's password.

    • addPatient

      public static void addPatient(Patient patient)
      Adds a new patient record to the existing list of patients in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      patient - The Patient object to be added to the patient CSV file.

    • addDoctor

      public static void addDoctor(Doctor doctor)
      Adds a new doctor record to the existing list of doctors in the CSV file and updates the internal list of doctors.
      Parameters:
      doctor - The Doctor object to be added to the doctor CSV file.

    • addAdmin

      public static void addAdmin(Administrator admin)
      Adds a new administrator record to the existing list of administrators in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      admin - The Administrator object to be added to the administrator CSV file.

    • addPharmacist

      public static void addPharmacist(Pharmacist pharmacist)
      Adds a new pharmacist record to the existing list of pharmacists in the CSV file and updates the internal list of pharmacists.
      Parameters:
      pharmacist - The Pharmacist object to be added to the pharmacist CSV file.

    • addCredential

      public void addCredential(String id, int hashValue, String salt)
      Adds a new credential record to the credentials CSV file. This record includes the user's ID, hashed password, and a cryptographic salt.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the user whose credentials are being added.
      hashValue - The hashed value of the user's password.
      salt - The cryptographic salt used in the hashing process.

    • findCredential

      public String[] findCredential(String id)
      Searches for and retrieves the hashed password and salt for a specific user's credentials based on their ID. Returns an array containing the hash and salt, or null values if the credentials are not found.
      Parameters:
      id - The user's ID for which to find the credentials.
      Returns:
      An array where the first element is the hashed password and the second element is the salt.

    • removeCredention

      public void removeCredention(String id)
      Removes a user's credential record from the credentials CSV file based on their ID. This method finds the credential by ID and removes it from the list before updating the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the user whose credential needs to be removed.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to initialize the application with default user credentials. Reads patient and staff information from CSV files, sets default passwords, and writes the credentials to a separate CSV file.
